column4: Does anyone know if your firewall iptables is not enabled, if it makes you vulnerable to attacks? I remember in Windows I was getting attacked all the time.
depends on who you ask..  you behind a router?
Linksys wrt54gl. Yeah and it's all good, yet Comodo still detects intrusions in Windows.
Oh, yes I know that. I was just asking if you have iptables disabled, would you still be safe.
why do you have it disabled?
can you please paste me what you said in case you responded? My internet crashed. :(
Just asked why you have iptables off.
before I answer that, is iptables the same as ufw ?
then it's not off sorry. I meant ufw is disabled.
Chain input policies are set to accept, what does that mean?
So is there any other way I might be at risk against attacks? Or just being on Ubuntu makes it hard to do that.
being on ubuntu makes it hard, but it really depends on what you are doing.
Like malicious websites trying to attack you.
